It was Valentines Day, the day of love. Who knew it will be turned into a day of bloodshed and violence.
Anger and outrage filled India yesterday when an SUV carrying more than 350kgs of explosives was rammed into a convoy in Jammu & Kashmir that had more than 40 jawans. It was the deadliest of all attacks in last two decades.
timesnownews.com
Claiming the responsibility for the brutal act was Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terror group. The car that rammed a CRPF bus was driven by terrorist Aadil Ahmad AKA Adil Ahmad Gaadi Takranewala AKA Waqas Commando of Gundibagh.
Right before the deadly attack, he said in a video that surfaced later on, “My name is Adil, I joined the Jaish e Mohammad a year ago. After a year's wait, I have got the chance to do what I joined the Jaish for... By the time this video reaches you, I will be in heaven... this is my last message for the people of Kashmir.”
40 CRPF Men Killed In Blast In Kashmir's Pulwama, Worst Attack In Decades
IED blast: Terrorist group Jaish-e-Mohammed has claimed responsibility for the Pulwama terrorist attack today. pic.twitter.com/YrYgzy14FY — Jagdish Chauhan (@Jagdish965148) February 14, 2019
